Operation 'rankCollect' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_context, unclear_purpose, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, not_actionable, poor_ai_interpretability. Original description is incorrect (says 'serp jobs' but operation is for rank collection) and lacks clarity. Missing summary entirely. Added context about the two-stage workflow, clarified this is the collection/retrieval phase, specified what inputs are needed (task IDs), and what outputs to expect (ranking data). This helps AI agents understand when to use this operation in the rank tracking workflow.

data.description_suggestion: Retrieves results from previously submitted rank tracking jobs. This is the second stage of the rank tracking workflow. Submit task IDs from earlier rank job submissions to collect their completed results. Returns ranking data for the tracked keywords and domains.
data.reasoning: Original description is incorrect (says 'serp jobs' but operation is for rank collection) and lacks clarity. Missing summary entirely. Added context about the two-stage workflow, clarified this is the collection/retrieval phase, specified what inputs are needed (task IDs), and what outputs to expect (ranking data). This helps AI agents understand when to use this operation in the rank tracking workflow.

message: Operation 'rankSubmit' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_context, unclear_purpose, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects, not_actionable, poor_ai_interpretability. Missing summary and vague description. Added context about the two-stage workflow, clarified this is the submission/initiation phase, explained the request schema usage, and emphasized the task ID return value and its purpose. Helps AI agents understand this is an asynchronous operation requiring follow-up collection.

data.summary_suggestion: Submit rank tracking job for processing
data.description_suggestion: Initiates a rank tracking job for monitoring keyword rankings. This is the first stage of the rank tracking workflow. Accepts rank tracking parameters via rankSubmitRequest and returns a task ID for later result collection. The task ID must be saved and used with the rank-collect endpoint to retrieve results once processing completes.
data.reasoning: Missing summary and vague description. Added context about the two-stage workflow, clarified this is the submission/initiation phase, explained the request schema usage, and emphasized the task ID return value and its purpose. Helps AI agents understand this is an asynchronous operation requiring follow-up collection.

message: Operation 'serpCollect' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_context, unclear_purpose, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, not_actionable, poor_ai_interpretability. Missing summary and misleading description (says 'submit' but operation collects results). Added context about the two-stage workflow, clarified this is the collection/retrieval phase, specified what inputs are needed (task IDs), and what outputs to expect (SERP data). Helps AI agents distinguish between submit and collect operations.

data.description_suggestion: Retrieves results from previously submitted SERP (Search Engine Results Page) analysis jobs. This is the second stage of the SERP workflow. Submit task IDs from earlier SERP job submissions to collect their completed results. Returns SERP data including search results, rankings, and related metrics.
data.reasoning: Missing summary and misleading description (says 'submit' but operation collects results). Added context about the two-stage workflow, clarified this is the collection/retrieval phase, specified what inputs are needed (task IDs), and what outputs to expect (SERP data).
